content.body: yeah it's not easy to know what's whatâ€¦
Intl is sort of in the middle, but it's in browsers and node, so it feels more language than web to me
and i do actually think most devs end up with a mental model of "browser stuff", "node stuff", and "universal/isomorphic stuff", and are pretty aware of the difference
* and i do actually think most devs end up with a mental model of "browser stuff", "node stuff", and "universal/isomorphic stuff", and are pretty aware of the difference

m.new_content.body: and i do actually think most devs end up with a mental model of "browser stuff", "node stuff", and "universal/isomorphic stuff", and are pretty aware of the difference

content.body: things like setTimeout, that are universal but not in the language spec, muddy the waters a bit, ofc
I think the distinction is mostly relevant for IO things
like, `fs` is node-only, the DOM is browser-only
content.formatted_body: like, fs is node-only, the DOM is browser-only
